lexUnit.name: astride.prep
lexUnit.definition: COD: with a leg on each side of

sentence.text: Originally a Celtic nature-goddess , depicted as a woman astride a mare , or a woman 's torso with a horse 's head .
She remembered paintings , one especially of Don Quixote astride a mule .
Matthew was astride the big chestnut mare Bess , who seemed to be his special favourite .
Aysgarth is a village astride the main road through Wensleydale , and the proud guardian of a spectacular section of the River Ure .
Zvornik , sitting astride the main road from Belgrade to Sarajevo , will play a linchpin role in the campaign to join together Serbian pieces of the ethnic jigsaw of Bosnia-Hercegovina .
The place was done up in his trademarked colossal style , with a huge pair of well-muscled stone legs standing astride the doorway to the main casino .
He sat astride a ladder-backed wooden chair , his legs splayed out in front of him .
She prayed the guttering would hold her weight as she slowly hauled herself up until she could sit astride the peak of the roof .
And when the great beast stopped to answer a call of nature , I felt as if I was sitting astride Mount Pinatubo .
But these were not just facsimiles of Big Ted and Little Ted , no : this time Hamble was dressed head to toe in leather astride a miniature Harley Davidson .
They were astride a single horse , tied back to back , being led along a skyline by the sheriff 's posse .
He lay beside her , hands caressing her , one leg astride her , rubbing , stroking .
G. One of the largest sources of energy , at present , in Britain and in the industrial areas astride the Pennines is oil .
It tipped over , sloshing liquid across the photograph of himself astride a motorcycle .
He sat astride the Lock gates and began to pull himself out along the top of them .
After his victim had been turned off the ladder , probably by the assistant hangman , Schlegel remained astride the cross-beam .
Iceland , astride the Mid-Atlantic Ridge , provides an excellent example .
The ancient town of Bridgwater , astride the River Parrett , is an ideal touring centre .
The Lakes sit astride the US-Canadian frontier , forming the world 's largest body of fresh water .
